intro: Pimpinella panatjan, commonly known as the Panatjan cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and streambanks. Pimpinella panatjan is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in temperate climates.
